 I remember thinking. It happened YET again, in another gun controlled country! 
 
 Dutch gun law is typical of the Western European approach. Firearm possession is not subject to any constitutional protections, but regulated simply in the Arms and Ammunition Act. Weapons, including firearms, are divided into four categories, and for each of the categories a certain maximum punishment is set for possession, and carrying in public.
 
 Only citizens who are hunters, members of shooting sports clubs or legitimate collectors may obtain licenses for firearms.
